text: Woo! My article is up!
Boom.
How many more first timers do we have until we move to the scheduled releases?
Not many
Word
I kinda felt like I was a fake invite until right now, like you guys needed comic relief or something
How does being published change that assessment? :smiling_imp:
<@U3L7A68JC>: btw, latest article had 2 random `P`s in the decklist because of an empty line in the `[Instants]` section
I didn't catch that, either. We will tighten up as we learn the system
sounds good
another thing to add to the author guide: full twitter url, not just the handle, or it won’t work
I’ll go ahead and fix patrick's
We need to standardize the titles and tagging. Maybe I will just tag every article
Yuck, so I am in an argument with a friend about one of the lines of play in my article on the specific rulings, might need to edit it when I have a chance to dig a little deeper, just a heads up
That won't be an option in the future
to clarify: we wont be able to edit articles in the future>

Aha, I will vet the rules a little harder then, the specifics of this is getting deeper than he or I thought at first, so I need to get home and read the rules without a 5 year old telling me they have a sister
And the only thing I can think when they do is "ok, but what does that have to do with numbers?"
Patrick, which line of play is in question?
The viscera seer activated ability being targeted by swords, as of right now I am pretty sure I am still correct about it but there are a couple more rules I might need to reread
When I read it that looked correct
Me too :/
I suspect the problem is one of semantics.
On your friend’s part...

Sacking R first, then in response, you sack KG and then Viscera Seer to itself. Those resolve, and then Viscera’s sack of R resolves, putting it’s trigger on the stack, which resolves and can bring back KG & VS. Seems solid.
It might very well be, clearer language has gotta be used me thinks
You almost wanna make a chart to explain this stuff haha, took me forever when I first started playing to understand fiend hunter exploit
The stack makes sense if you have a programming background :wink:
However, doing a visual aid is a good idea.
Patrick, given your combo focus you might think about doing more detailed rules explanations since often those combos involve the dark and murkier parts of the rules.
I get it now at least :sweat_smile:
In the future - it could be a regular section of your column a ‘here are the rules involved in this combo’ if needed.
I was thinking that as well
Visuals always help. Trying to draw up card interactions can sometimes be confusing and overwhelming
Yikes!
My favorite example of diagrams helping explain combos
This is great
Here’s a quick and dirty example...
You would also want reveillarks LTB effect on the stack there too, beneath sacking karmic guide and v seer
I think?
What program did you use to make that?

Omni Graffle since I’m on a Mac, but Visio is the Windows equivalent. Also, technically Reveillark’s trigger doesn’t go on until after Viscera Seer’s sacrifice of it resolves, so it would be a dotted line event contingent upon the first resolving.
Does the fact the sacrificing is the cost (as opposed to the resolution) make a difference? Not trying to debate, I'm genuinely curious
That’s why I have Viscera Seer Sacrifice: with the colon to indicate it is the triggered ability.
Gotcha
How’s this?
I like it
ok, the more I think about it, the more I am convinced I'm right in this instance, and he isn't really understanding what I'm saying
short of a high level judge coming in and being like "yo, these are the rules you missed" I'm comfortable leaving it as is

his problem stemmed from if you let the viscera seer's ability to resolve before sacrificing the rest of the guys, then yes, it wouldn't work, but when you declare an activated ability, a new object is created that is just the words of the ability, that allow you to preform those actions, so you haven't resolved the activated ability, and you can go ahead and do so again and again, then resolve each one on the stack
Correct, you merely put it onto the stack and then declare that in response to that activation...
Yep. The sacrifice is part of the activation cost, meaning the creature is dead before the scary happens
Hrm…good point, I ignored the Scry triggers
I’ll add those in as they are the result while the sacrifice is the cost.
this is kinda hard to understand if you don't play mtgo to be honest
Oh, MTGO doesn’t get this right all the time either, which muddies the waters
Yep. All costs are paid in order to get the ability onto the stack
How dare you call omnigraffle equivalent to visio

Also, technically Reveillark’s trigger doesn’t go on until after Viscera Seer’s sacrifice of it resolves, so it would be a dotted line event contingent upon the first resolving.

and bloated it up

Yes, the activation costs are paid, the scry ability is put on the stack, then any death triggers would happen on top of the scry ability
Playing abzan company in modern makes you learn how the stack with death triggers happen real quick
